messages: 550bb4c9a840c14f94d758971d068100 (05:45): anyone has the snippetmagic thingie of rosejn.net? I'm unable to connect to the website
378faf40356350e1145fcd6ccb0bbf5f (06:07): Hi, I am trying to :%s /path/to/file/here to another path.  I tried :%s+path+to+file+here/new+path+to+file but that didn't work.
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (06:10): don't change your path separators; only the substitute separators

5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:30): the last buffer i was watching
e80c143a423e281121609fea24853177 (06:30): no I sacrificed my whole herd already, I had like 30 buffers open
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:31): see, i need to figure out how to actually navigate that
e80c143a423e281121609fea24853177 (06:31): you'll need a sheepdog, I think
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:34): i dunno, its just some weird option in gvim
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:34): yeah, thats what i want to know
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:34): i havent the faintest _ of an idea
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:35): You clearly know the feature since you are asking about it, I don't have the slightest clue what you could even be talking about.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:35): i swear i'm asking out of desperate hope for the opposite
636bec0d368a75856b029e8e18bcdef4 (06:36): is there a way to jump to a line number?
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:36): myren: What are you talking about, you asked about an option that I assumed you are looking at.
a1853287db1b5745e319461a1b89f3ac (06:37): Is there a key binding to delete a line without exiting the insert mode (like ctrl+w to delete the previous word) ?
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (06:37): myren.. so you desperately want to know how to use a certain feature.. but you don't know what it does?
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:38): deryni: its edit->global settings->tag files.  "enter names of tag files.  Seperate the names with a comma." and its ./tags,./TAGS,tags,TAGS as the default.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:38): thats is the entirity of what i know
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:38): and i havent the foggiest idea what it is
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:39): That is for tag files, not tagging files. google for exuberant-ctags.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:39): its the only thing in the entirety of gvim's default menu's on debian that i dont have some idea of
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:39): i doubted gnome had gotten around to putting leaftag into gvim yet
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:39): its probably like mutt, i assume
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:40): I'm not sure what Gnome has to do with gvim, nor do I know what leaftag is, but exuberant-ctags is nothing like mutt (if that is what you meant).
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (06:40): any: deryni gave you an answer: ^odd
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:41): Right, sorry, I should have pointed you at that.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:41): how do i open a buffer by name?
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:43): I don't know what you mean.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (06:45): I don't know how you got from buffer loading to tagging
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:46): how do i switch to a particular buffer by filename?
74538b806ff81fd4a9bf6b8f6b85d198 (06:46): anyone know how to tell :vimgrep how to search the currently open buffers?
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (06:46): myren: tag it, then jump to it by tag
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (06:48): goflyapig are you just messing with him?
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (06:55): wait how do i tag my files?
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (06:56): myren: You don't, stop listening to goflyapig. But you can use just part of the buffer/file name in :b or :e commands.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (07:01): thanks.  i think i can actually use vim capably now.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (07:01): sorry for asking such stupid questions, but the tutorial has been great, thank you
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (07:02): i couldnt find it for a long long time
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (07:02): (couldnt find it in my distros package list... which was weird)
0c40c1bf00d55d35ab17baf2cbec36f8 (07:03): I think it just comes with vim.
5ef382098221da582785caed3b8d84c3 (07:16): how do i move the window down one line?
